author: carlbeek
content:
The KZG Ceremony just went live and everything seems to be going fantastically! This has been a massive amount of work over a time period much longer than I think any of us expected, but thank you so much to everyone here for the effort they put into this project, I am extremely proud of what we have achieved!

A huge shout out to Nico Serrano, Geoff Lamperd and Chiali Takamichi Tsutsumi from Privacy & Scaling Explorations, Remco Bloemen, Marcin Kostrzewa, Grzegorz ≈öwirski and Philipp Sippl from Worldcoin, Rafael Matias, and Parithosh Jayanthi from EF DevOps, in addition to Kevaundray Wedderburn, Marius Van Der Wijden, Daniel Knopik, Ignacio Hagopian, Antonio Sanso and Paul Wackerow amoung many others for doing an incredible amount of work to enable this Ceremony.

author: logarithmicrex
content: Congrats <@550420431744794624> ! I've been folllwing the ceremony for a while now and I am so excited we've reached this day! The interface is incredible and the experience is awesome. I have never been so excited to wait in 600 minute queue before!! Congrats to the entire team for such a special way to do this!

author: protolambda
content: Awesome work on launching the KZG ceremony! The lobby is getting larger and larger, maybe someone from the project can communicate what happens if you quit the lobby, how the sequencer is performing, etc.?

author: logarithmicrex
content: Interesting... I just switched browser tabs for a moment and came back and the kzg ceremony had logged me out. Made me resign back in (both times) and dropped me back in the lobby. I assume I lost my place in line?

author: protolambda
content: Times can vary wildly, 15 min is relatively low. Not everyone is lucky with the random selection. I was in the lobby for about 2.5 hours total. With a lobby that went from 100 to 300+ participants. And we're at 400+ now, so it may take a while. Worth it though üôÇ

author: chaserxy
content:
hey, three questions:
1. what is the exact cut-off time for public contributions?
2. which client has the lowest hardware requirements?
3. is there a client that allows adding manual input to the randomness? asking for a friend who likes dices

author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> 1) 192 seconds (but entropy is collected before you start contributing, so it doesn‚Äôt count towards that time)
2) no idea, it will depend on the hardware and how optimised the crypto library is for that architecture 
3) i believe all of them do

author: trent_vanepps
content:
we're also giving a pessimistic, naive measure: 3 minutes per lobby member

in practice it takes ~30 seconds per contrib, and ranges between 20s -1min

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> contributions are taking 45s on average

author: trent_vanepps
content:
we're also troubleshooting some sequencer timing issues which some participants are experiencing

> The call to sequencer came too early. Submit an issue in Github

author: chaserxy
content: carlbeek, thanks. for my 1st question, I meant the global deadline, but I think I managed to decipher the numerology there and it's 2023-03-13t13:13:13z

author: trent_vanepps
content:
more context on timelines:

Open contribution period: (2 months jan 13 - march 13) anyone shows up, pings the server with their randomness, selection from the lobby is random

"Special" contribution period (1 month): we will work with participants to schedule a slot for their implementation or unique randomness contribution where a special accomodation is needed (eg. blowing up an airgapped computer post contribution)

post special, reverts back to open contribution until Cancun / 4844 goes live

https://notes.ethereum.org/@CarlBeek/kzg_ceremony_timelines

author: jsign
content:
Two UX improvements in https://github.com/jsign/go-kzg-ceremony-client done some minutes ago: 1. honor the sequencer rate limiting waiting 30s and not 15s to ask for our turn, 2. nicier message if your session-id got expired and have to log-in again (might happen with people got bored waiting and would retry later when it has expired; so just explain them that you should login again).
pull again the repo, or download the new release binaries if you're planning to use the client.

author: angelbattles
content:
It would be nice to let people in the lobby know that the next person will be chosen randomly. It would also be nice to know that one person is chosen every minute. 

Overall, congrats to everyone who made this happen. It's such a cool feeling for individuals to be able to contribute to making this secret number
